selected_quotes: patient perceptions of #BMD results and #osteoporosis risk status helpful in treatment initiation

citation.abstract: Potential mediating factors in the pathway to initiation of osteoporosis treatment following a fragility fracture were evaluated. Patients' perceived need for treatment, mediated by their perception of bone density test results, was central to treatment initiation. Interventions focusing on patients' perceptions of need and test results may improve treatment rates.
citation.title: Factors influencing the pharmacological management of osteoporosis after fragility fracture: results from the Ontario Osteoporosis Strategy's fracture clinic screening program.

news.title: Patients who are engaged in their own care are more likely to reduce the risk of future fractures
news.summary: By Leslie Shepherd - People over the age of 50 who have suffered a fracture because of a slip or trip play a central role in making sure they get proper care to prevent a future fracture, a new study has found.
